nodes.description: Initial TURBT shows NMIBC

nodes.question: Was the initial resection visually complete?
Is there carcinoma in situ (CIS) or Ta¹ present?

nodes.description: Visual incompleteness or high-volume tumour → ‘T1 or consider for select Ta¹’ ⇒ Repeat TURBT
Proceed to Management per NMIBC Risk Group (BL-3)
Stage II (cT2 N0) Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer pathway

low_risk.label: Low Risk
criteria: Papillary urothelial neoplasm of low malignant potential
Low-grade urothelial carcinoma AND stage Ta AND size ≤ 3 cm AND solitary lesion

intermediate_risk.label: Intermediate Risk
criteria: Low-grade urothelial carcinoma AND (stage T1 OR size > 3 cm OR multifocal OR recurrence < 1 year)
High-grade urothelial carcinoma AND stage Ta AND size ≤ 3 cm AND solitary lesion

high_risk.label: High Risk
criteria: High-grade urothelial carcinoma AND (CIS OR stage T1 OR size > 3 cm OR multifocal)
Any very-high-risk feature: BCG-unresponsive, certain histopathologic subtypes, lymphovascular invasion, prostatic urethral invasion

footnotes.high_volume_tumour: High-volume tumours (large or highly multifocal) are at high risk of residual tumour.
footnotes.repeat_turbt_guidance: Consider repeat TURBT for high-grade Ta, particularly if large and/or no muscle in specimen.
footnotes.muscle_presence: Muscle should be present in repeat TURBT pathology specimen whenever possible.

cystoscopy_positive.action: Reclassify AUA Risk Group and manage accordingly

follow_up.note: If prior BCG, maintenance BCG preferred

cystoscopy_positive.action: Reclassify AUA Risk Group and manage accordingly

initial.therapy: Pembrolizumab OR Nadofaragene firadenovec-vncg OR Nogapendekin alfa inbakicept-pmln + BCG (select patients)

follow_up.note: If prior BCG, maintenance BCG preferred

cystoscopy_positive.action: Reclassify AUA Risk Group and manage accordingly

footnotes.°: Should consider single peri-operative instillation of intravesical chemotherapy at time of TURBT.
footnotes.q: Options for intravesical therapy for intermediate-risk disease include BCG and chemotherapy; consider BCG availability.
footnotes.r: If not a cystectomy candidate and recurrence is high-grade cTa or cT1, consider concurrent chemoradiotherapy (category 2B for cTa, category 2A for cT1) or a clinical trial (see BL-G).
footnotes.s: Pembrolizumab may be considered for BCG-unresponsive, high-risk NMIBC as detailed in BL-3 footnote 5.
footnotes.t: Nadofaragene firadenovec-vncg may be considered for BCG-unresponsive, high-risk NMIBC with CIS (± papillary).
footnotes.u: Nogapendekin alfa inbakicept-pmln + BCG may be considered for BCG-unresponsive, high-risk NMIBC with CIS (± papillary).
footnotes.very_high_risk_features: Lymphovascular invasion, prostatic urethral involvement, or aggressive histologic subtype (e.g., micropapillary, plasmacytoid, sarcomatoid).

name: Positive_Urine_Cytology_Workup
category: Management of Positive Urine Cytology (Imaging– / Cystoscopy–)
description: Work-up and management for patients with positive urine cytology but negative imaging and cystoscopy

footnotes.*: Enhanced cystoscopy if available; otherwise proceed with bladder biopsies ± ureteroscopy.

name: Positive_Urine_Cytology_Workup
category: Management of Positive Urine Cytology (Imaging– / Cystoscopy–)
description: Evaluation and treatment paths when urine cytology is positive but imaging and cystoscopy are negative

nodes.description: Recurrent / persistent disease follow-up: cytology (+), imaging (–), cystoscopy (–)
Consider repeat cytology ≤ 3 mo, mapping biopsies (incl. prostate*), upper-tract cytology, ureteroscopy, enhanced cystoscopy*, non-urinary tract search (vagina, cervix, rectum), refer as needed

nodes.question: Site of positive findings after work-up

nodes.description: Bladder / prostate / upper tract negative → follow-up at 3 mo then extend interval; if prior BCG, maintenance BCG optional
Bladder source identified → reclassify AUA risk group and manage accordingly
Prostate source → follow Urothelial Carcinoma of the Prostate pathway
Upper-tract source → follow Upper GU Tract Tumors pathway

footnotes.d: Enhanced cystoscopy if available; otherwise proceed with bladder biopsies ± ureteroscopy.

name: NMIBC_Follow_Up
description: Surveillance schedule after initial management of NMIBC

nodes.question: Current AUA risk group (per BL-2 reassessment)

nodes.description: Low-risk NMIBC follow-up schedule

footnotes.*: Within each risk strata an individual patient may have more or fewer concerning features that can influence care.
footnotes.a: Kamat AM, et al. J Clin Oncol 2016;34:1935-1944.
footnotes.b: See aggressive subtype histologies listed on Bladder Cancer: Non-Urothelial and Urothelial with Subtype Histology (BL-D).
footnotes.c: See AUA Risk Stratification for Non-Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer definitions on BL-2.

name: NMIBC_Follow_Up
category: Bladder Cancer – Non-Muscle-Invasive Follow-Up (Intermediate & High Risk)
description: Surveillance schedules for intermediate- and high-risk NMIBC after initial management

nodes.description: Intermediate-risk NMIBC follow-up schedule
High-risk NMIBC follow-up schedule

footnotes.c: See AUA Risk Stratification for Non-Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer definitions on BL-2.
footnotes.d: See Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).

name: NMIBC_Follow_Up
description: Surveillance schedule after cystectomy performed for non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer

nodes.description: Post-cystectomy NMIBC follow-up schedule

imaging.year_1: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) at 3 & 12 mo
imaging.year_2_to_4: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) annually

year_1: CBC & CMP every 3-6 mo if chemotherapy was received
Consider urethral-wash cytology every 6-12 mo ⁹

footnotes.d: See Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.e: Renal ultrasound is to look for hydronephrosis.
footnotes.f: Liver-function testing (LFT) includes AST, ALT, bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase.
footnotes.g: Urethral-wash cytology is reserved for patients with high-risk disease: multifocal CIS, prostatic urethral invasion.

name: MIBC_Post_Cystectomy_Follow_Up
description: Surveillance schedule after cystectomy performed for muscle-invasive bladder cancer

nodes.description: Post-cystectomy MIBC follow-up schedule

year_1: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) every 3–6 mo
CT chest (preferred) or chest x-ray every 3–6 mo
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease suspected
year_2_to_3: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) every 3–6 mo
CT chest (preferred) or chest x-ray every 3–6 mo
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease suspected
year_4: CT chest (preferred) or chest x-ray annually
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease suspected

year_1: CBC & CMP every 3–6 mo if chemotherapy was received
year_2_to_4: B₂ annually based on clinical judgement
blood_tests.year_5_plus: B₂ annually based on clinical judgement

year_1: Consider urethral-wash cytology every 6–12 mo ᵍ

footnotes.d: See Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.e: Renal ultrasound is performed to look for hydronephrosis.
footnotes.f: Liver-function testing (LFT) includes AST, ALT, bilirubin, and alkaline phosphatase.
footnotes.g: Urethral-wash cytology is reserved for patients with high-risk disease (positive urethral margin, multifocal CIS, prostatic urethral invasion).

name: Post_Bladder_Sparing_Follow_Up
category: Bladder Cancer – Post-Bladder Sparing (Partial Cystectomy / Chemoradiation)
description: Surveillance schedule for patients who retained their bladder after surgery or chemoradiation

nodes.description: Follow-up plan after bladder-sparing treatment

year_1_to_2: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) every 3–6 mo for MIBC
CT chest (preferred) or chest x-ray every 3–6 mo for MIBC
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease suspected
year_3_to_4: CT chest (preferred) or chest x-ray annually
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease suspected
imaging.year_5_plus: renal_ultrasound_annually ᵉ and/or imaging as clinically indicated

year_1: CBC & CMP every 3–6 mo if chemotherapy received

footnotes.d: See Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.f: LFT includes AST, ALT, bilirubin, and alkaline phosphatase.
footnotes.h: For patients not eligible for aggressive therapy, surveillance may be less frequent (e.g., cystoscopy every 6 months, then annually).
footnotes.i: PET/CT is not recommended for NMIBC.
footnotes.e: Renal ultrasound is to look for hydronephrosis.

name: Metastatic_Disease_Surveillance
description: Follow-up schedule for patients with metastatic bladder cancer who are under surveillance

nodes.description: Surveillance plan once metastatic disease is diagnosed or suspected

year_1_plus: CTU or MRU (upper tracts + axial abdomen/pelvis) every 3–6 mo if clinically indicated and with any clinical change or new symptoms
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis every 3–6 mo and with any clinical change or new symptoms
FDG-PET/CT (category 2B) only if metastatic disease is suspected
Vitamin B₁₂ annually for patients who have undergone a cystectomy (based on clinical judgment)

footnotes.d: See Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).

name: MIBC_Stage_II_Management
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer (Stage II – cT2 N0)
description: Work-up, primary treatment options, and subsequent management for clinical stage II MIBC

nodes.description: Clinical staging: Stage II (cT2, N0)
Perform additional work-up
tasks: CT or MRI abdomen/pelvis if not previously done
Chest imaging (CT chest)
Bone scan or MRI if suspicion/symptoms of bone metastases
Estimate glomerular filtration rate (GFR) to assess cisplatin eligibility

nodes.description: Proceed to Adjuvant Treatment

nodes.question: Reassess tumor status 2–3 mo after treatment completion

nodes.description: Surveillance ± systemic therapy/RT ± TURBT ± intravesical therapy and best supportive care
TURBT ± intravesical therapy

nodes.question: Is patient a candidate for surgical re-resection?

footnotes.g: Neoadjuvant cisplatin-based combination chemotherapy ± peri-operative/sandwich immunotherapy.
footnotes.d: Partial cystectomy only in highly-selected solitary lesions, no CIS.
footnotes.p: Intravesical therapy per Principles of Instillation Therapy (BL-E).
footnotes.aa: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy.
footnotes.bb: See footnotes on BL-6 for timing details.
footnotes.cc: Maximal TURBT required before bladder-preservation chemoradiotherapy.

name: MIBC_Adjuvant_Treatment
description: Systemic / radiation options after radical or partial cystectomy

nodes.question: Which clinical scenario applies after cystectomy?

nodes.description: If gemcitabine + cisplatin + durvalumab was given pre-op → continue durvalumab post-op
pT3, pT4a, or pN+ without prior cisplatin: discuss adjuvant cisplatin-based chemo (preferred) **or** nivolumab/pembrolizumab
ypT2–ypT4a or ypN+ after cisplatin neoadjuvant: consider nivolumab **or** pembrolizumab
pT3-4 with positive nodes or margins: consider adjuvant radiation (category 2B)

footnotes.c: Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.z: Adjuvant cisplatin chemo preferred if no prior cisplatin and high pathologic risk.
footnotes.ee: Most appropriate for patients wishing to delay recurrence even if cure chance was low.
footnotes.bb: See Principles of Radiation Management of Invasive Disease (BL-H).

name: MIBC_Stage_IIIA_Management
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer (Stage IIIA – cT3 N0, cT4a N0, or cT1–cT4a N1)
description: Work-up, primary treatment, and subsequent management for clinical stage IIIA MIBC

nodes.description: Clinical staging: Stage IIIA (cT3, N0; cT4a, N0; or cT1–cT4a, N1)
Perform additional imaging and labs
tasks: CT or MRI abdomen/pelvis if not previously done
Chest imaging (CT chest)
Bone scan or MRI if suspicion / symptoms of bone metastases
Estimate GFR to assess cisplatin eligibility

nodes.description: Proceed to Adjuvant Treatment (BL-6)

nodes.question: Reassess tumor status 2–3 mo after treatment completion

nodes.description: Surveillance
TURBT ± intravesical therapy then follow-up

nodes.question: Is patient a candidate for surgical re-resection?

footnotes.d: Partial cystectomy only in highly-selected solitary lesions, no CIS.
footnotes.aa: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy.
footnotes.bb: See BL-6 footnotes for reassessment timing.
footnotes.cc: Optimal chemoradiation candidates lack multifocal CIS and have <6 cm tumor.

name: MIBC_Stage_IIIB_Management
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer (Stage IIIB – cT1–cT4a, N2-3)
description: Work-up, down-staging therapy, and subsequent management for clinical stage IIIB MIBC

nodes.description: Clinical staging: Stage IIIB (cT1–cT4a, N2-3)
Perform additional imaging / labs
tasks: CT or MRI abdomen/pelvis if not previously done
Chest imaging (CT chest)
Bone scan or MRI if suspicion or symptoms of bone metastases
Consider molecular/genomic testing ᵍᵍ
Estimate GFR to assess cisplatin eligibility

nodes.description: Give down-staging systemic therapy ᵈᵈ

nodes.question: Reassess tumor status 2–3 mo after treatment completion ʰʰ

nodes.description: Consolidation cystectomy **or** consolidation chemoradiotherapy **or** surveillance
Treat as metastatic disease

footnotes.c: Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.dd: Down-staging systemic therapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy (BL-G 2 of 7).
footnotes.aa: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy.
footnotes.bb: See Principles of Radiation Management of Invasive Disease (BL-H).
footnotes.gg: Consider molecular / genomic testing per Principles of Alternative Risk Classifiers (BL-I).
footnotes.hh: Imaging with CT of chest/abdomen/pelvis with contrast; if no distant disease, further cystoscopic assessment may be considered.
footnotes.ii: If complete response achieved, treat recurrence according to stage of recurrent disease.

name: MIBC_Stage_IVA_Management
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer (Stage IVA – cT4b Any N M0 or Any T Any N M1a)
description: Work-up, primary treatment, and subsequent management for clinical stage IVA disease

nodes.description: Clinical staging: Stage IVA (cT4b Any N M0 --OR-- Any T Any N M1a)
Obtain baseline studies
tasks: CT or MRI abdomen/pelvis if not previously done
Chest CT
Bone scan or MRI if bone symptoms / suspicion
Molecular / genomic testing ᵍᵍ
Estimate GFR to decide cisplatin eligibility

nodes.question: Reassess tumor status 2-3 mo after treatment

nodes.description: Consider consolidation systemic therapy **or** chemoradiotherapy (if no prior RT) ± cystectomy, then follow-up
Systemic therapy **or** chemoradiotherapy (if no prior RT) ± cystectomy, then follow-up
Systemic therapy ᵈᵈ for M1a disease
Consider consolidative local therapy in selected cases (non-bulky, no significant progression), then follow-up
Treat as metastatic disease

footnotes.c: Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.dd: Systemic therapy details – see Principles of Systemic Therapy (BL-G 5 of 7).
footnotes.aa: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy.
footnotes.bb: Principles of Radiation Management of Invasive Disease (BL-H).
footnotes.gg: Principles of Alternative Risk Classifiers & Biomarkers (BL-I).
footnotes.hh: If complete response, recurrence should be treated per stage of disease (BL-11).

name: MIBC_Stage_IVB_Metastatic
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer (Stage IVB – Metastatic: Any T, Any N, M1b)
description: Initial work-up and first-line management of metastatic bladder cancer

nodes.description: Clinical staging: Stage IVB (Any T, Any N, M1b)
Perform baseline imaging / labs
tasks: Bone scan or MRI if bone symptoms / suspicion
Chest CT
CNS imaging if neurologic symptoms (category 2B)
Estimate GFR to assess cisplatin eligibility
Consider biopsy if technically feasible
Molecular / genomic testing ᵍᵍ

nodes.description: Systemic therapy (see BL-G 2 of 7 & 4 of 7) **and/or** palliative radiotherapy (BL-H). Then enter surveillance.

footnotes.c: Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.bb: Principles of Radiation Management of Invasive Disease (BL-H).
footnotes.dd: Systemic therapy details – Principles of Systemic Therapy (BL-G 2 of 7).
footnotes.kk: See Principles of Systemic Therapy (BL-G 3 of 7 and 4 of 7).
footnotes.gg: Principles of Alternative Risk Classifiers & Biomarkers (BL-I).

name: Recurrent_or_Persistent_Disease
category: Muscle-Invasive Bladder Cancer – Recurrent / Persistent Disease
description: Management after a curative-intent course when disease recurs or persists

nodes.description: Recurrent or persistent disease detected on surveillance
Metastatic or local recurrence after cystectomy

nodes.question: Initial evaluation with cytology / imaging / cystoscopy

nodes.description: Cytology positive, imaging negative, cystoscopy negative → work-up
Cystectomy **or** chemoradiotherapy (if no prior RT) **or** systemic therapy **or** palliative TURBT + best supportive care
Proceed to cystectomy
Return to routine follow-up

footnotes.c: Principles of Imaging for Bladder/Urothelial Cancer (BL-A).
footnotes.p: Intravesical therapy per Principles of Instillation Therapy (BL-E).
footnotes.aa: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy per Principles of Systemic Therapy.
footnotes.bb: Principles of Radiation Management of Invasive Disease (BL-H).
footnotes.dd: Systemic therapy details – see Principles of Systemic Therapy (BL-G 3-7).
footnotes.kk: See systemic therapy options BL-G 3 of 7 and 4 of 7.
